at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf

Class DataPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf.DataPoint

  • public class DataPoint
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the basic interface to actor and sensor data, which can be used by GBots. It contains all the methods for data point configuration and an observer for signalling data and state changes.

    This class ist thread-safe. That means that concurrent access to the methods of this class by multiple threads cannot corrupt the own internal data structures. Data and state changes are signalled by the DataPointObserver in an own thread, so be careful.

    The following example shows, how DataPoints can be used: 

    
    // At first we need a DataPoint instance.
    DataPoint dataPoint = new DataPoint();

    // Now we can query available buffers
    Collection<BufferDescription> availableBuffers = dataPoint.queryBuffersByMetainfo("^oufen$", "(keen)|(nischt)");

    // Wow, now we can select the best matching buffers.
    ...

    // And then we assign the buffers to the data point
    dataPoint.assign(myFavoriteBuffer);
    dataPoint.assign(anotherPrettyBuffer);
    ...

    // A short time later, the state should be BufferState.READY and we can work with buffers.
    Map<String, SimpleData> allData = dataPoint.getAll();
    ...
    dataPoint.addObserver(myDataPointObserver);
    ...

    // All work is done. Now we detach the assigned buffers.
    dataPoint.detach(myFavoriteBuffer);
    dataPoint.detach(anotherPrettyBuffer);
    ...

    // Finally we should release the system resources used by the data point.
    dataPoint.release();

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Called by the garbage collector on this object when garbage collection determines that there are no more references to the object. All used system resources are released.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - the Exception raised by this method

      • release

        public void release()
        Detaches all assigned buffers and sets the state of this data point to BufferState.RELEASED. This method may be called more than once. If the state of this data point is BufferState.RELEASED, the method call will have no effect.

      • getState

        public BufferState getState()
        Gets the overall state of this data point. The state of the data point is derived from the states of the assigned buffers in such way:
        • After calling the method release(), the state is BufferState.RELEASED.
        • If the connection to the buffer daemon is broken, the state is BufferState.ISOLATED.
        • If no buffer is assigned, the state is BufferState.INITIALIZING.
        • If an assigned buffer is in BufferState.FAULTED state, the state is BufferState.FAULTED.
        • If an assigned buffer is in BufferState.RELEASED state, the state is BufferState.FAULTED.
        • If an assigned buffer is in BufferState.INITIALIZING state, the state is BufferState.INITIALIZING.
        • Otherwise the state is BufferState.READY.
        Returns:
        the state of the data point, which is never null.

      • queryBuffersByName

        public java.util.Set<BufferDescription> queryBuffersByName(java.lang.String name)
        This method looks for available buffers.
        Parameters:
        name - a regular expression specifying the buffer name, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole name.
        Returns:
        a collection of all the buffers matching this query

      • queryBuffersByMetainfo

        public java.util.Set<BufferDescription> queryBuffersByMetainfo(java.lang.String topic,
                                                               java.lang.String feature)
        This method looks for available buffers.
        Parameters:
        topic - a regular expression specifying the buffer topics, which should be scanned for the wanted features. These are keys of the buffer meta information. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole topic name.
        feature - a regular expression specifying the buffer features, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole feature description.
        Returns:
        a collection of all the buffers matching this query

      • queryBuffersByMetainfo

        public java.util.Set<BufferDescription> queryBuffersByMetainfo(java.lang.String feature)
        This method looks for available buffers. This query scans all topics of the buffer for the requested feature.
        Parameters:
        feature - a regular expression specifying the buffer features, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole feature description.
        Returns:
        a collection of all the buffers matching this query

      • getBufferDescription

        public BufferDescription getBufferDescription(java.lang.String name)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method returns the meta information of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of a buffer
        Returns:
        the buffer meta information, which is never null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there exists no buffer with the given buffer name

      • assign

        public void assign(java.lang.String bufferName)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Assigns a buffer for read or write access to this data point. This method will have no effect, if the buffer is currently assigned to this data point.
        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there exists no buffer with the given buffer name

      • isAssigned

        public boolean isAssigned(java.lang.String bufferName)
        Is a buffer assigned to this data point?
        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        true, if the buffer is currently assigned to this data point
        See Also:
        assign(String), detach(String)

      • getAssignedBufferNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAssignedBufferNames()
        Read the names of all buffers assigned to this data point.
        Returns:
        a set of buffer names which may be empty, if there are no buffers assigned to this data point.
        See Also:
        assign(String), detach(String)

      • detach

        public void detach(java.lang.String bufferName)
        Detaches a buffer from this data point. This method will have no effect, if the buffer is currently not assigned to this data point.
        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the buffer

      • get

        public SimpleData get(java.lang.String bufferName)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get the current information about a buffer attached to this data point. Sensor buffers return the value read from the hardware. Actors return the last value set to the buffer. For convenience actor buffers return an error state, if the hardware is or was in this state and no value was set.
        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        the current buffer data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - there is no buffer with the given buffer name assigned to this data point

      • getAll

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SimpleData> getAll()
        Get the current information about all the buffers attached to this data point.
        Returns:
        a map with the names of all currently attached buffers as key and their values as data. The result may be empty, but is never null.

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String bufferName,
                java.lang.Number value)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the value to an actor assigned to this data point.
        Parameters:
        bufferName - the name of the actor buffer
        value - the new value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the buffer isn't assigned to this data point or is not changable (e.g. an actor)

      • addDataPointObserver

        public void addDataPointObserver(DataPointObserver observer)

        Adds a new data point observer to the set of well known observers. If the observer argument is null or the observer argument is currently registered in this object, the method call will have no effect. Note that the registered observers are a set. Multiple registration will not cause multiple notifications about state or value changes.

        The observer instance will be notified about changes in a separate thread!

        Parameters:
        observer - the observer

      • removeDataPointObserver

        public void removeDataPointObserver(DataPointObserver observer)

        Removes a data point observer from the set of well known observers. If the observer argument is null or the observer argument is currently not registered in this object, the method call will have no effect.

        Parameters:
        observer - the observer

      • getTimeControl

        public TimeControl getTimeControl()
        Get an object, which allows time triggered retrieval of buffer data.
        Returns:
        a new instance for time triggered retrieval of buffer data

      • getStream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<SimpleData> getStream()
        Returns a stream of all buffer value changes of this data point. After calling this method, all current buffer values are put into this stream. Then value changes are signalled by putting the new buffer value into the stream. If there are no buffer value changes available, the calling thread is blocked. Detaching a buffer will cause a value change to the buffer state BufferState.RELEASED. Releasing this data point will automatically detach all assigned buffers. No more data changes are signalled with this stream.
        Returns:
        a stream of value changes

      • addCallback

        public void addCallback(long delay,
                        SDGCallback... cb)
        Adds SDGCallbacks to this data point. If some callbacks are already registered, the callbacks are removed and scheduled with the new delay.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay in milliseconds. At least 100msec are assumed.
        cb - the callback

      • removeCallback

        public void removeCallback(SDGCallback... cb)
        Removes SDGCallback from this data point. If some callbacks are not registered, the method has no effect for these callbacks.
        Parameters:
        cb - the callback
